IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Monday the 24" day of February, 2025./ 5" Phalguna, 1946.
CC. 2440/2018
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poonthura
Police Station in Crime No. 1688/2016.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Manu. J.J, S/o. Jayarajan, aged 28 years, S/o. Jayarajan,,
Melevaruvila House, Muttalakuzhi, Punchakkari,
Thiruvallam Village.
2. Kunjumon, aged 49 years, S/o. Sekharan, Kizhakkekari
Puthan Veedu, TC. 65/1433, Near Punchakkari Junction,
Punchakkari Ward, Thiruvallam Village.
3. Vishadkumar, aged 42 years, S/o. Sasi, Kumar Mandiram,
Near Punchakkari School, Punchakkari Ward, Thiruvallam
Village.
4. Raji, aged 47 years, S/o. Thankappan, Melathumala
House, Near Nelliyode Temple, Punchakkari, Punchakkari
Ward, Thiruvallam Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Anoopchandran R.S)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and
506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused numbers 1 to 4 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and 506(ii) read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are
acquitted of the said offences under section 248(1) Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and
they are set at liberty.

2 of 7
Description of accused

Thiruvallam Village | Thiruvananthapuram
3. Vishadkumar Thiruvallam Village | Thiruvananthapuram

11.02.2024 21.02.2025 24.02.2025
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341, 323,
324 and 506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief _is as follows :- Due to the prior enmity on
22.09.2016, at 20.30 hours, accused nos. 1 to 4 wrongfully restrained CW1 at
the public road that situated to the eastern side of NH Bypass road,
Ambalathara Ward, Muttathara Village. It is alleged that accused Nos. 1 and 2
by uttering obscene words, caught hold on the shirt of CW1 and hit on his

3 of 7
back, when he fell down, accused no.2 struck on his head with a wooden plank
resulting injury. Further, accused nos. 3 and 4 beaten CW2 and CW3 who
were accompanied CW1. Thus accused Nos. 1 and 2 thereby have committed
offenses u/s. 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and 506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Poonthura police station
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thiravananthapuram and
the case was taken on file as C.P. 82/2016. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable wu/ss. 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and 506(ii) read with section
34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the accused persons. On 27.03.2017 the
case was committed to the Honourable Special Court (Children’s Court),
Thiruvananthapuram as per the Provisions of Child Rights Act, 2005. Further
the case was transferred to the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II,
Thiruvananthapuram u/s. 228(1) Cr.PC as per the order in SC No. 588/17
dated 07.10.2017 of the Honourable Additional Sessions Judge for the trial of
cases relating to Atrocities and Sexual Violence against Women and Children,
Thiruvananthapuram and the case was refiled as CC. 1618/2017. Thereafter, it
was transferred to this court, in pursuance of the order of the Hon'ble Chief
Judicial Magistrate, Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as CC.
2440/2018.

4 of 7

4. On appearance of the accused Nos. 1 to 4 they were enlarged on bail on
28.09.2016. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to them
under section 207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing
prosecution and counsel for accused Nos. 1 to 4, charge framed for offences
wss. 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and 506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860., read over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 to 4 to which they
pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 to PW3 were examined and Exhibit P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW3 to CW7. In the absence
of any incriminating circumstances against the accused Nos. 1 to 4,
questioning of the accused Nos. 1 to 4, under section 313(1)(b) Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with. Accused Nos. 1 to 4 were
called upon to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the
side of the accused Nos. 1 to 4.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 22.09.2016, at 20.30 hours, at the public road that situated to
the eastern side of NH Bypass road, Ambalathara Ward, Muttathara Village
infurtherance of their common intention of accused nos. 1 to 4, accused

5 of 7
Nos. 1 and 2 by uttering obscene words towards PW1 which is a public
place and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 4 committed offence punishable under
section 294(b) read with Sec. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(2) Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 4 infurtherance of
their common intention, wrongfully restrained PW1 and thereby accused
Nos. 1 to 4 committed offence punishable under section 341 r/w. 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(3) Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 4 in furtherance of
their common intention, accused Nos. 1 and 2 caused hurt to PW1 by
caught hold on the shirt of PW1 and accused nos. 3 and 4 beaten CW2 and
CW3 and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 4 committed an offence punishable
ws. 323 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(4) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 4 in
furtherance of their common intention, accused no.2 struck PW1’s head
with a wooden plank and thereby accused Nos. 1 to 4 committed an offence
punishable w/s. 324 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(5) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 4 in
furtherance of their common intention threatened PW1 and thereby
committed an offence punishable w/s. 506(ii) r/w. section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 ?

(6) If the accused Nos. 1 to 4 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 5:-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 5. are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused nos. 1 to 4 have
committed offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341, 323, 324 and
506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 .

6 of 7

9. PW1 admitted his signature in the Ext. P1 statement. PW1 deposed that he had
been assaulted by some body during night with wooden plank by the accused
persons were not assaulted him and he has no grievance against the accused
persons.

10. PW2 deposed that he got injury by the incident but he denied the statement
before the police and he has no grievance against the accused persons.

11.PW3 deposed that he was assaulted by some body but the accused persons
never assaulted him.

12.On analysing the evidence of PW1 to PW3 it can be seen that, there is no
evidence to conclude that accused Nos. 1 to 4 have committed the offences.

13. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and she
is justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused Nos. 1 to 4 and for the
said reason these points are found against the prosecution.

14, Point No. 6 :- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 to 5, the accused numbers 1 to
4 are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341, 323,
324 and 506(ii) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are

7 0f7
acquitted of the said offences under section 248(1) Code of Criminal
Procedure, 1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.
The wooden piece was produced before this court as T No. 351/2016 will be
destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 24" day of February, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
